commitmsg: Allow to specify the keypairs used when generating a token for test purposes
Prep for version 0.4.0, the "PyBrowserID" rename.
Allow audience patterns to be passed to verify() method.
Require a list of audience patterns as first argument to a Verifier.
Rename from PyVEP to PyBrowserID
Allow jwt RSA and DSA keys to be instanciated direcly with the underlying M2Crypto object

Allow customisation of the key fecthing mechanism

This is mainly useful to add support of local certificates.
Some syntactic tweaks and notes after merging the refactor.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'ametaireau/master'
Reorganize the test suite and refactor the Verifiers.
Update README to reflect removal of vep.verify_local()

Remove vep.verify[remote|local|dummy] functions.

They were adding needless confusion.  Clients should either use the
defaults provided by vep.verify(), or use a full-blown Verifier object.
simplified the custom jwt
Allow the customization of the JWT parser used in the local verifier
Bump to version 0.3.2
Fix some ctypes pointer usage by declaring explicit types.
Update license to MPL 2.0

Merge pull request #2 from ametaireau/master

Fixed some typos
Typos + Flake8

Added an experimental "WorkerPoolVerifier" class.

This class wraps a verifier in a simple multiprocessing worker pool,
making it easy to side-step the GIL and get better performance on
multi-core machines.
bump to version 0.3.1
RemoteVerifier: update audience parsing for new assertion format
adding a TODO file
fix typo in comment
Final changelog tweaks for 0.3.0 release
Use binascii.unhexlify for even faster int2mpint
docstring cleanup

More efficient implementation of int2mpint.

This implementation encodes to hex and then decode that to binary.
It's more efficient than a python-level loop encoding straight to
binary, because both loops are done in C-level code.

(If this were ever to run on PyPy, we should rever to the old version)

Bring test coverage back up to 99%.

This is still missing some hard-to-test corner cases, but it covers
a lot of very valuable ground.

Upgrade to latest spec for retrieving public keys.

Previously it used an XML document located at /.well-known/host-meta.
Now it uses a JSON document located at /.well-known/vep.
bump to version 0.3.0

Implement a basic expiration/eviction policy for cached public keys.

This patch makes the LocalVerifier keep a maximum of 1000 public keys
cached in memory, and expire them after 1 hour.  It also allows the user
to specify any dict-like object to use for the cache, so other policies
can easily be implemented.
some docstring/comment cleanups

Add some shortcuts for verifying with default options.

You can now do vep.verify(assertion) to just use default everything.
That's much nicer than creating an object just to call its verify()
method.

Clean up internal JWT-handling API.

It now uses module-level functions rather than classmethods.
Preliminary support for new-style bundle format.
fix flake

Warn rather than fail is ca_certs cannot be found.

This lets people open themselves up to a MITM attack if they're not
careful, but I've seen too many new users fall over this step to be
comfortable leaving it as a hard failure.
Test whether warnings are issued as expected.

Add vep.utils.get_assertion_info() function.

This grabs the most interesting bits of information out of an assertion
without actually verifying it.
bump version to 0.2.1
Use M2Crypto for faster DSA operations.

Monkey-patch M2Crypto.DSA to allow loading keys from raw params.

The M2Crypto API doesn't support creating a DSA key from its raw
parameters, instead wanting to load it from an ASN.1 formatted blob.
This patch uses ctypes to hack together an alternative.
LocalVerifier: print FutureWarning at correct stack level.

Fix tests to depend less on the expired pre-generated assertions.

The server-side keys keep changing and breaking the tests, so I'm
replacing them with more use of the DummyVerifier mock keys.
Update expired test assertions for latest public keys.
Don't emit FutureWarning when using DummyVerifier
Make it easy to generate jwcrypto-compatible mock assertions.
fix some flake
bump version to 0.2.0

Increase test coverage to 97%

(The untested lines are pretty obviously right and tedious to test,
so I'm going to leave it at that for now)
LocalVerifier.verify: return more data e.g. issuer and valid-until

Add a basic exception hierarchy, subclassing vep.errors.Error.

This makes it much easier for calling code to determine what went
wrong, e.g. AudienceMismatchError if the audience doesn't match,
InvalidSignatureError if the signature is bad, etc.
Adjust metadata for 0.2.0 in preparation for release

Put each verifier class in its own module; implement DummyVerifier

The DummyVerifier class subclasses LocalVerifier, stubbing out the
key-fetching logic to use locally-generated dummy keys.  It also lets
you generate both good and bad assertions for testing purposes.
Fix flake
Refactor testcases into separate files for easier maintenance.

Validate the root issuer before checking the cerficate chain.

This means we fail fast for untrusted assertions, and avoid doing
lots of crypto that isn't needed.
Doc tweaks and typo fixes
Only emit FutureWarning when someone creates a LocalVerifier instance.
fix dates and formatting in CHANGES.txt
Metadata for v0.1.1 release
Add some more signature algorithms
adjust default list of trusted secondaries
Fall back to "hostname/pk" if "hostname/.well-known/host-meta" is 404
Add a warning about possible changes to the certificate format.
putting canonical repository under mozilla/PyVEP
doc tweaks
add vep.__version__
update readme
Include test TLS certificates in distribution
fix flake
Refactor JWT code into submodule, add support for DSA keys.
Add a breif README to the certs directory
Adding initial code for PyVEP.

Merge pull request #41 from Mozilla-GitHub-Standards/master

Add Mozilla Code of Conduct

Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #40.

Prep v0.14.0

Remove warning about possible changes to assertion format.

Since the project was shut down, the format is pretty obviously
not going to change, so the warning is just noise.
Prep v0.13.0

Merge pull request #35 from mozilla/local-verify-by-default

Use LocalVerifier by default, now that the hosted verifier has shut down
Use LocalVerifier by default, now that the hosted verifier has shut down.
Prepare v0.12.0

Merge pull request #34 from mozilla/idp-claims

Add support for extra IDP claims in the LocalVerifier
Fix travis-ci config
Add support for idpClaims/userClaims in LocalVerifier
Skip remote tests when hosted verifier is down.
Prep v0.11.0

Merge pull request #32 from mozilla/validate-email-in-assertion

Validate email in assertion

Validate the email address parsed out of an assertion.

This is potentially attacker-provided data and should
be treated with suspicion.
Add python3 in travis config
Prepare v0.10.0 release
Add support for idpClaims and userClaims in test assertions.
Bump dev version number
Prepare v0.9.2 release
Fix some docs and typos

Merge pull request #27 from GraylinKim/fix_tuple_unpacking

Remove tuple parameter unpacking for python3

Remove tuple parameter unpacking for python3.

See http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3113/

Merge pull request #26 from jessaustin/error-descriptions

Added Error Descriptions
added error descriptions

Merge pull request #23 from ThomasWaldmann/patch-2

fix typo in README.rst
fix typo in README.rst
Update changelog for 0.9.1 release.

Add tests for signing/verifying strings with different characteristics.

This will hopefully prevent re-appearance of issues with e.g. odd-vs-even
string lengths, leading zero bytes, etc.
Deduplicate logic of int2bytes function.
bump the dev version on the setup.py as well
Bump development version to 0.10.0
Prepare for 0.9 release.
Add tox.ini for testing across different python versions.

Native python3 support, without requiring 2to3 translation.

This commit targets the common subset of the language supported by
python26, python27 and python31.

Preliminary support for Python3.

This commit sorts out some string/bytes abmiguity and does a couple of
synxtax changes to support Python3 via 2to3 translation.  Key points:

    * JWTs are always b64url-encoded utf8-encoded JSON data
    * crypto routines only ever work with bytes, not unicode strings
Merge branch 'rfk/netutils-module'
Refactor netutils try-except logic into a common "request" function.
Add the release date for 0.8 in the changelog
bump the version to 0.9 (for next release)
Catch socket.error during GET or POST, report it as ConnectionError.
Refactor request-handling code into "netutils" sub-module.
Point setup.py to the right place for tests.
Rename SIGSIZE to DIGESTSIZE and add some comments on Key properties.

Fix the pure-python RSA implementation.

This commit also adds extensive tests to cross-verify the M2Crypto
and pure-python versions against one another.
Prevent M2Crypto segfault when trying to sign with an RSA public key.
Remove self-signed SSL certs, they're not longer used in the tests.

Merge pull request #15 from mozilla/ametaireau/remove-mock-dep

mock is not supposed to be a dependency
mock is not supposed to be a dependency
bump version
preparation of the 0.7 release
More replacement of browserid.org with persona.org.
Update RemoteVerifier to use persona.org URLs.

Define an is_trusted_issuer() method on the LocalVerifier class.

This is a convenient hook point is subclasses want to do this
differently, e.g. by farming the support-doc-fetching out to some
worker processes.
Add test for passing wildcard audiences to verify() method.
Merge branch 'release/0.6'
Prep 0.6.2 release.
Add persona.org and related sites to default trusted secondaries.
Add persona.org and related sites to default trusted secondaries.

Fix is_trusted_issuer() for sites that don't declare support.

Previously the delegation check was throwing a ConnectionError because it
could not fetch the support document.

Merge pull request #13 from mozilla/rfk/delegated

Rfk/delegated
Change "supportdoc_manager" attribute to just "supportdocs".
Remove the now-empty TODO file.
Mention delegated authority support in the changelog.
Rename "WellKnownManager" to "SupportDocumentManager".
Fix handling of multiple levels of delegation.
Support delegated primaries
Turn the certificate manager into a manager for well-known files

Merge branch 'release/0.6'

Conflicts:
	CHANGES.txt
	setup.py
Update CHANGELOG for 0.6.1 release
Bump version to 0.6.1

Disable certificate chaining for now.

This feature is not used by any servers in the wild, and the spec
for it is going to change soon.
Merge master with rfk/pure-python-crypto
prepare next release
Bump version number to 0.6
Update changlog.
Add "from_pem_data" and "to_pem_data" methods to JWT Key objects.
Provide a pure-python fallback for when M2Crypto is not available.

Add a way to configure the verification of ssl certs
Add a way to configure the verification of ssl certs

Remove ability to use a custom JWT subclass for parsing.
Remove ability to use a custom JWT subclass for parsing.
Prepare metadata for next version number
Remove dead code, fix flake.

Tests to ensure the audience is handled properly.

Because the audience can be specified at different locations (ie. at
instanciation time and when calling the "verify" method), we need to be sure
that the overwritting works like expected.

This tests the different possible scenarios for the local verifier.
bump version
update the CHANGES.txt file
add more verbose errors when dealing with RSA/DSA keys
remove unused import
Give the url on connectin error. Fix #3.
patched_urlopen is not needed anymore
add travis-ci support
fix the unittest/unittest2 issue
